65151. Adoption of Islam

Mataram — Not random

Conditions

  • None of the following must occur:
    • State religion is sunni
    • State religion is eastern_sunni

Will happen within 60 days of January 2, 1447
Checked again every 60 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1448)

Description

Kertawijaya, brother of Suhita, became King of Majapahit in 1447. He converted to Islam on the advice of his wife, Darawati, a princess of Champa. His nephew, Sunan Ampel, the first notable member of the Nine Walis or Walisongo, Islamic teachers who worked to spread Islam around Java in the late 1400s and early 1500s, begins his conversion work in central Java.

Actions

A. Convert to one true faith

  • +2 base tax value in Borobudur
  • Change religion to eastern_sunni
  • Stability -3
  • Centralization +1
  • Global revolt risk +3 for 12 months
  • Offensive Doctrine +1
  • +2 missionaries

B. Retain the faith of grandfathers

  • -1 base tax value in Borobudur
  • Stability +1
  • Centralization -1

Back to top

234226. The reign of Rajasavardhana

Mataram — Not random

Conditions

  • None of the following must occur:
    • State religion is sunni
    • State religion is eastern_sunni

Will happen within 50 days of January 2, 1451
Checked again every 50 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1452)
unless prevented by
Action A of 234227 - The reign of Rajasavardhana for Mataram

Description

King Kertavijaya was murdered and replaced by Rajasavardhana, who hinders the spread of Islam in Majapahit.

Actions

A. Suppress that religion!

  • Stability -1
  • Global revolt risk +2 for 24 months
  • Centralization +1
  • Innovativeness -1
  • Serfdom +1
  • +2 missionaries
  • -1 base tax value in a random province

B. Let them spread their religion

  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • Centralization -1
  • Innovativeness +2
  • Serfdom -1
  • -1 missionaries
  • Global revolt risk +6 for 240 months
  • The capital province revolts

Back to top

Mataram — Not random

    • State religion is sunni
    • State religion is eastern_sunni
  • The following must not occur:
    • Event 234226 - The reign of Rajasavardhana for Mataram has already occurred

Will happen within 50 days of January 2, 1451
Checked again every 50 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1452)

Description

King Kertavijaya was murdered and replaced by Rajasavardhana, who hinders the spread of Islam in Majapahit.

Actions

A. We are Hindu Kingdom, not Islam!

  • Stability -3
  • Change religion to hindu
  • Global revolt risk +3 for 24 months
  • A random province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • Centralization +1
  • Aristocracy +1
  • Serfdom +1
  • Innovativeness -1
  • +2 missionaries
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • Event 234226 - The reign of Rajasavardhana for Mataram will never fire

65152. Court Rebellion

Mataram — Not random

Will happen on December 30, 1467

Description

Bhre Kertabhumi rebelled against Suraprabhawa and drove out the latter out of his court at Tumapel. Suraprabhawa moved his seat to Daha, near Kediri. The great state of Majapahit is in chaos. At this time many remaining Hindus flee Java for Bali.

Actions

A. Rebellion!

  • Stability -3
  • Centralization -1
  • Global revolt risk +4 for 24 months
  • A random province revolts
  • A random province revolts

234000. The End of the Majapahit Empire

Mataram — Not random

Conditions

  • None of the following must occur:
    • State religion is sunni
    • State religion is eastern_sunni

Will happen within 300 days of January 2, 1478
Checked again every 300 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 31, 1819)

Description

In 1478, the region of Daha revolted, and the disintegrating Majapahit empire fell into chaos, losing virtually all their posessions outside of Java. The Sultanate of Demak was rapidly founded and quickly inherited the Majapahit mantle. They began to convert Java to Islam.

Actions

A. The Sultanate of Demak will now rule

  • -3000 population in Borobudur
  • -1000 population in a random province
  • -1000 population in a random province
  • Change religion to eastern_sunni
  • Grant independence to Banjar
  • Grant independence to BLI
  • Grant independence to LUW
  • Grant independence to Kutei
  • Grant independence to Ternate
  • Grant independence to BIM
  • Grant independence to Banten
  • Grant independence to SUL
  • Grant independence to Palembang
  • Grant independence to Brunei
  • Event 427000 - The End of the Majapahit Empire for Banjar is triggered immediately
  • Event 80707 - The End of the Majapahit Empire for BLI is triggered immediately
  • Event 320000 - The End of the Majapahit Empire for LUW is triggered immediately
  • Event 426000 - The End of the Majapahit Empire for Kutei is triggered immediately
  • Event 308003 - The End of the Majapahit Empire for Ternate is triggered immediately
  • Event 407001 - The End of the Majapahit Empire for BIM is triggered immediately
  • Event 439001 - The End of the Majapahit Empire for Banten is triggered immediately
  • Event 438000 - The End of the Majapahit Empire for SUL is triggered immediately
  • Event 80708 - The End of the Majapahit Empire for Palembang is triggered immediately
  • Event 126000 - The End of the Majapahit Empire for Brunei is triggered immediately
  • Religion in the capital province changes to sunni
  • Religion in a random province changes to sunni

B. No! We must keep the empire alive!

  • Stability -6
  • Global revolt risk +10 for 60 months
  • A random province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • Religion in a random province changes to sunni

Back to top

234228. Demak attacks Portuguese in Malacca

Mataram — Not random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Mataram and Portugal are at war
  • Portugal owns Tassaret
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • State religion is sunni
    • State religion is eastern_sunni

Will happen within 50 days of January 2, 1518
Checked again every 50 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1521)

Description

Yunus (Pangeran Sabrang Lor) led fleet from Demak and Cirebon against the Portuguese in Melaka. Yunus was killed in battle.

Actions

A. Liberate Malacca from the infidels!

  • Stability +1
  • Offensive Doctrine +1
  • +5000 infantry in the capital province
  • Gain 5 galleys in a random province
  • Start a war with Portugal
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Portugal for 36 months
  • +50 relations with Malacca
  • +50 relations with Palembang
  • +50 relations with Siak
  • +50 relations with Atjeh

B. We aren't strong enough

  • Stability -2
  • The capital province revolts
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Portugal for 36 months

Back to top

234229. Banten converts to Islam

Mataram — Not random

Conditions

  • Own Banten
  • The following must not occur:
    • Banten exists

Will happen within 50 days of January 2, 1523
Checked again every 50 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1525)

Description

Gunungjati and son Hasanuddin did both covert and overt missionary work in West Java to weaken the Kingdom of Pajajaran and its alliance with the Portuguese. Local ruler of Banten, formerly dependent on Pajajaran, converted to Islam and joined Demak's side.

Actions

A. Convert to Islam

  • Religion in Banten changes to sunni
  • -50 relations with Portugal
  • Revolt risk value in Banten +4

Back to top

65156. Islam spreads in Java

Mataram — Not random

Conditions

  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • State religion is sunni
    • State religion is eastern_sunni

Will happen within 600 days of January 2, 1525
Checked again every 600 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1540)

Description

Sultan Trenggana (of Demak) is remembered as a ruler who did much to spread Islam throughout East and Central Java. Gunungjati and son Hasan ud-Din do both missionary work in West Java to weaken the Kingdom of Pajajaran and its alliance with the Portuguese. Local ruler of Banten, formerly dependent on Pajajaran, converts to Islam and joins Demak's side (1524).

Actions

A. Convert the heathens to one true faith

  • Religion in a random province changes to sunni
  • Stability -1
  • +1 base manpower in the same province
  • +2 missionaries

B. Forbid preaching of Islam

  • Stability -2
  • -3 missionaries

Back to top

234200. Sultan Agung banned the sale of rice to the VOC

Mataram — Not random

Conditions

  • Own Borobudur
  • Netherlands exists
  • Event 3503 - Vereenigde Oostindische Compagnie for Netherlands has already occurred

Will happen within 5 days of December 2, 1618
Checked again every 5 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1619)

Description

Sultan Agung banned the sale of rice to the VOC. Agung's governor of Jepara attacked the VOC post there and the Dutch burned down much of Jepara in retaliation.

Actions

A. Ban the sale!

  • -100 relations with Netherlands
  • Borobudur revolts
  • Trade tech investment: -200
  • -2 merchants
  • Lose courthouse in Borobudur
  • Event 186400 - Sultan Agung banned the sale of rice to the VOC for Netherlands is triggered immediately

B. Sale the rice

  • +50 relations with Netherlands
  • +100

Back to top

234201. Jan Pieterszoon Coen burnt Jepara

Mataram — Not random

Conditions

  • Own Borobudur
  • Netherlands exists

Will happen within 5 days of May 2, 1619
Checked again every 5 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after June 2, 1619)

Description

Jan Pieterszoon Coen passed through Jepara, and burnt down the city again, including the English trading post.

Actions

A. Darn!

  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Netherlands for 6 months
  • -50 relations with Netherlands
  • -1 base tax value in Borobudur
  • -500 population in Borobudur
  • Event 164500 - Jan Pieterszoon Coen burnt Jepara for England is triggered immediately

234202. Sultan Agung attacks Batavia for the first time

Mataram — Not random

Conditions

  • Netherlands owns Arawan
  • The following must not occur:
    • Mataram and Netherlands are at war
  • Event 3503 - Vereenigde Oostindische Compagnie for Netherlands has already occurred

Will happen within 30 days of January 2, 1628
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1629)

Description

Sultan Agung sent army against VOC in Batavia and dammed Ciliwung River in attempt to deny fresh water to the VOC. He failed to oust the Dutch, who prevent his army from receiving supplies by sea. Commanders of the Mataram army were executed for failure.

Actions

A. Attack Batavia!

  • Start a war with Netherlands
  • -200 relations with Netherlands
  • +5000 infantry in the capital province
  • +1000 cavalry in the capital province
  • Gain 5 galleys in a random province
  • Offensive Doctrine +1

B. We aren't strong enough

  • Stability -1
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Netherlands for 12 months

Back to top

234205. Cooperation treaty between VOC and Mataram

Mataram — Not random

Conditions

  • Netherlands owns Arawan
  • Event 3503 - Vereenigde Oostindische Compagnie for Netherlands has already occurred

Will happen on September 25, 1646

Description

Cooperation treaty between VOC and Mataram, involving promises of mutual assistance against enemies and extradition of runaway debtors, among other things. Ships of Mataram may trade at any VOC port except Ambon, Ternate or Banda, but must apply for a pass at Batavia if they are sailing for Melaka or points beyond.

Actions

A. Sign the treaty

  • +50 relations with Netherlands

B. Don't sign the treaty

  • -50 relations with Netherlands

Back to top

65153. Incompetence of Amangkurat I

Mataram — Not random

Will happen within 200 days of December 30, 1660
Checked again every 200 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1664)

Description

Amangkurat I had a reputation for being cruel and unpredictable. Besides his disastrous interference in the economy, at one time he had many of the Islamic scholars in Mataram killed, then took their former judicial powers for himself, turning himself into an absolute ruler. In 1661 a group of nobles attempted a court rebellion against Amangkurat I, which was cruelly suppressed.

Actions

A. Assume the dictatorial powers

  • Stability -3
  • Centralization +1
  • Monarch's administrative skill -2 for 48 months
  • Monarch's military skill +2 for 48 months
  • Global revolt risk +4 for 24 months
  • A random province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • Infrastructure tech investment: -500
  • Mercantilism +1
  • Serfdom +1

B. Maintain the old system

  • Stability +1
  • Monarch's administrative skill +2 for 48 months
  • Monarch's military skill -2 for 48 months
  • Mercantilism -1

Back to top

234208. Rebellion in Mataram

Mataram — Not random

Will happen within 30 days of January 2, 1675
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1676)

Description

Rebellion in Mataram, with help from Trunojoyo. Makassarese exiles attacked ports on north coast of Java. Trunojoyo of Madura took Surabaya. Rebels appeal to Islamic sentiments among the common people against both the court of Mataram and the VOC.

Actions

A. Crush the rebels

  • Stability -2
  • The capital province revolts
  • Majapahit revolts
  • Global revolt risk +3 for 60 months

Back to top

234209. Four years of warfare

Mataram — Not random

Will happen within 10 days of June 2, 1705
Checked again every 10 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after October 2, 1705)

Description

Army of Paku Buwana I with VOC help took the court of Mataram at Kartasura. The VOC bribed the commander of the troops at Kartasura, allowing them to take Salatiga and other approaches without significant resistance. Raden Surya Kusuma is strangled but other officials who remain are allowed to keep their posts. Amangkurat III fled to Surapati with the pusaka (emblems or heirlooms of the house of Mataram) and moveable assets in gold and jewels. Four years of warfare began.

Actions

A. Take the court!

  • Stability -2
  • Global revolt risk +3 for 48 months

Back to top

234210. Mataram becomes VOC's protectorate

Mataram — Not random

Conditions

  • Netherlands owns Arawan
  • The following must not occur:
    • Mataram is a vassal of Netherlands
  • Event 3503 - Vereenigde Oostindische Compagnie for Netherlands has already occurred

Will happen on October 6, 1705

Description

Paku Buwana I made a deal with the VOC: Mataram debts to VOC were wiped out, East Madura went to VOC control, Semarang was officially a VOC city after years of occupation, Cirebon was officially a VOC protectorate and VOC got extensive trade rights. Javanese sailors must stick to their home waters and Mataram must deliver rice on demand to the VOC at a price set by the VOC. In addition, the two sides agreed that no other European nation will be allowed to build factories or fortifications anywhere on Java.

Actions

A. Make a deal with VOC

  • +100 relations with Netherlands
  • Trade tech investment: -200
  • Naval tech investment: -200
  • Event 186404 - Mataram becomes VOC's protectorate for Netherlands is triggered immediately

B. Don't make a deal

  • -100 relations with Netherlands
  • -200

Back to top

234211. Jaya Puspita's rebellion

Mataram — Not random

Conditions

  • Own Majapahit
  • Mataram is a vassal of Netherlands

Will happen within 30 days of January 2, 1717
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1718)

Description

The son of the Adipati of Surabaya, Jaya Puspita, led a renewed rebellion against Mataram in the areas around Surabaya, Kediri, Probolinggo, Balambangan, and Madura, with help from Bali. The VOC organized further reinforcements to counter the threat.

Actions

A. Crush them!

  • -1 base tax value in Majapahit
  • Majapahit revolts
  • Majapahit revolts

Back to top

65155. Court Rebellion

Mataram — Not random

Will happen within 20 days of February 23, 1719
Checked again every 20 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after May 2, 1719)

Description

After Amangkurat IV took rule in Mataram, a court rebellion broke out almost immediately and rebel princes fled eastward. A combined VOC and Mataram force drove the rebels back from Kediri to Malang.

Actions

A. Rebellion!

  • Stability -2
  • Global revolt risk +4 for 24 months
  • A random province revolts
  • A random province revolts

234213. Sunan Kuning's rebellion

Mataram — Not random

Conditions

  • Own Borobudur
  • Mataram is a vassal of Netherlands
  • Event 3503 - Vereenigde Oostindische Compagnie for Netherlands has already occurred

Will happen within 30 days of January 2, 1742
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1743)

Description

A popular rebellion under Sunan Kuning, a grandson of Amangkurat III, against the VOC and Mataram took hold in the countryside. Nata Kusuma, Pangeran Mas Said and the rebellious Chinese from Batavia contribute. The rebellion took Kartasura and held it for four months and Paku Buwana II fled with his family.

Actions

A. Crush them!

  • Stability -3
  • Borobudur revolts
  • Borobudur revolts
  • Revolt risk value in Borobudur +3

Description

Paku Buwana II gave VOC Surabaya, Rembang, Jepara and claims to easternmost Java and West Madura. VOC received a say in court appointments.

  • +200

B. That land is ours!

234218. Treaty of Gijanti

Mataram — Not random

Conditions

  • Event 3503 - Vereenigde Oostindische Compagnie for Netherlands has already occurred
  • Event 234215 - Mangkubumi's rebellion for Mataram has already occurred

Will happen on February 14, 1755

Description

Sultan Hamengku Buwana got VOC recognition of title and lands. Separation of Yogyakarta and Surakarta into two separate principalities. Treaty required Sultan Hamengku Buwana to ally himself with the VOC against Mas Said.

B. Be strong and independent

  • Stability -1

234219. Mas Said becomes Mangku Negara I

Mataram — Not random

Conditions

  • Monarch Hamengku Buwana I  is active
  • Own Borobudur
  • The following must not occur:
    • Event 234220 - Mas Said becomes Mangku Negara I for Mataram has already occurred

Will happen within 30 days of January 2, 1758
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1759)
unless prevented by
Action A, B, C of 234220 - Mas Said becomes Mangku Negara I for Mataram

Description

Hostilities between the VOC, Yogya, Surakarta and Pangeran Mas Said ended. Mas Said became Pangeran Mangku Negara I with his court also at Surakarta. VOC had control of all the north coast provinces.

Actions

A. Support Hamengku Buwana I

  • Stability +1
  • +50 relations with Netherlands
  • Revolt risk value in Borobudur -3
  • Event 234220 - Mas Said becomes Mangku Negara I for Mataram will never fire

B. Support Paku Buwana III

  • Stability +1
  • +50 relations with Netherlands
  • Revolt risk value in Borobudur -3
  • Monarch Hamengku Buwana I  will never rule
  • Monarch Hamengku Buwana II  will never rule
  • Monarch Pakubuwana III becomes active
  • Monarch Pakubuwana IV becomes active
  • Event 234220 - Mas Said becomes Mangku Negara I for Mataram will never fire

C. Support Mangku Negara I

  • Stability -1
  • +50 relations with Netherlands
  • Revolt risk value in Borobudur -3
  • Monarch Hamengku Buwana I  will never rule
  • Monarch Hamengku Buwana II  will never rule
  • Monarch Mangku Negara I  becomes active
  • Monarch Mangku Negara II  becomes active
  • Event 234220 - Mas Said becomes Mangku Negara I for Mataram will never fire

Back to top

234220. Mas Said becomes Mangku Negara I

Mataram — Not random

Conditions

  • Monarch Pakubuwana III is active
  • Own Borobudur
  • Event 3503 - Vereenigde Oostindische Compagnie for Netherlands has already occurred
  • The following must not occur:
    • Event 234219 - Mas Said becomes Mangku Negara I for Mataram has already occurred

Will happen within 30 days of January 2, 1758
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1759)
unless prevented by
Action A, B, C of 234219 - Mas Said becomes Mangku Negara I for Mataram

Description

Hostilities between the VOC, Yogya, Surakarta and Pangeran Mas Said ended. Mas Said became Pangeran Mangku Negara I with his court also at Surakarta. VOC had control of all the north coast provinces.

Actions

A. Support Paku Buwana III

  • Stability +1
  • +50 relations with Netherlands
  • Revolt risk value in Borobudur -3
  • Event 234219 - Mas Said becomes Mangku Negara I for Mataram will never fire

B. Support Hamengku Buwana I

  • Stability -1
  • +50 relations with Netherlands
  • Revolt risk value in Borobudur -3
  • Monarch Pakubuwana III will never rule
  • Monarch Pakubuwana IV will never rule
  • Monarch Hamengku Buwana I  becomes active
  • Monarch Hamengku Buwana II  becomes active
  • Event 234219 - Mas Said becomes Mangku Negara I for Mataram will never fire

C. Support Mangku Negara I

  • Stability -1
  • +50 relations with Netherlands
  • Revolt risk value in Borobudur -3
  • Monarch Pakubuwana III will never rule

234221. Fortification of Yogyakarta

Mataram — Not random

Conditions

  • Monarch Hamengku Buwana I  is active
  • Own Borobudur

Will happen within 30 days of January 2, 1785
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1786)

Description

Future Hamengku Buwana II of Yogya built fortifications around the Kraton.

Actions

A. Build fortification

  • -100
  • Fortress level in Borobudur +1

B. We don't have money

  • -20 victory points

Back to top

234222. Paku Buwana IV's plan

Mataram — Not random

Conditions

  • Monarch Pakubuwana IV is active
  • Own Borobudur
  • Event 3503 - Vereenigde Oostindische Compagnie for Netherlands has already occurred

Will happen within 30 days of January 2, 1790
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1791)

Description

Rumors spread that Paku Buwana IV was planning a massacre of Dutch in Java, and tookover of the Yogya and Mangkunegara courts. Forces from Yogya and VOC surrounded Surakarta. Paku Buwana IV ordered his advisors to leave court and VOC sent them into exile.

Actions

A. Darn!

  • Monarch's administrative skill -2 for 60 months
  • -50 relations with Netherlands
  • Revolt risk value in Borobudur +3

Back to top

234223. Mangku Negara II inherits court

Mataram — Not random

Conditions

  • Monarch Mangku Negara II  is active
  • Event 3503 - Vereenigde Oostindische Compagnie for Netherlands has already occurred

Will happen within 30 days of January 2, 1796
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1796)

Description

Mangku Negara II inherits court, but much of the treasury was stolen by the VOC resident at Surakarta.

Actions

A. The treasury was stolen!

  • -100
  • -50 relations with Netherlands
